summary: Internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing media leaks about Jeffrey Epstein's arrest for sex trafficking of minors. The emails note that details of the indictment and the handling unit have been leaked to the Daily Beast and Miami Herald, and mention Epstein's attorney declining to comment.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the arrest and indictment for sex trafficking of minors, as reported in media leaks.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who declined to comment to the Daily Beast regarding the arrest.

connections.description: Martin Weinberg is identified as Epstein's attorney in the context of his arrest for sex trafficking.

events.title: Epstein Arrest for Sex Trafficking
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested for sex trafficking of minors, with details of the indictment and the SDNY unit handling the case leaked to the media.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested for sex trafficking of minors, with the case being handled by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
Details of the indictment and the specific unit handling the case were leaked to the Daily Beast and Miami Herald prior to official release.
Epstein's attorney, Martin Weinberg, declined to comment to the Daily Beast on the night of the arrest.
The email chain indicates internal concern within the SDNY about the media leaks regarding the Epstein case.
